DataElement.preferredName: Breast Carcinoma Computer Analysis Data Field Group Texture Histogram java.lang.Long
DataElement.preferredDefinition: (brest KAN-ser) Cancer that forms in tissues of the breast, usually the ducts (tubes that carry milk to the nipple) and lobules (glands that make milk). It occurs in both men and women, although male breast cancer is rare.:A machine for performing calculations automatically.:Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.:An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit._A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.:A bar chart representing a frequency distribution where the heights of the bars represent observed frequencies._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

It occurs in both men and women, although male breast cancer is rare.:A machine for performing calculations automatically.:Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.:An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.
A machine for performing calculations automatically.

Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.
An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.:A bar chart representing a frequency distribution where the heights of the bars represent observed frequencies.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
